text.0: A challenge to an Idaho law prohibiting transgender girls and women from joining female athletic teams raises important questions about the complex biology underlying sex, legal protections against discrimination, and human rights for transgender people.
text.1: FDA withdrawal of the approval for 17OHP, as imperfect as the drug may be, will leave a very vulnerable demographic group of U.S. women at high risk for recurrent preterm birth with absolutely no available therapeutic option.
text.2: The FDA’s Center for Drug Evaluation and Research has recommended withdrawing the approval of Makena for the prevention of recurrent preterm birth after a trial failed both to verify clinical benefit to neonates and to substantiate a reduction in preterm birth.

text.4: Nearly 200,000 U.S. children were diagnosed with #COVID19 in October — accounting for 23% of all pediatric cases since the pandemic began.
text.5: The NEJM Clinical Cases Resource Center aggregates educational content and interactive cases to help medical professionals advance their clinical diagnostic and therapeutic skills, and to provide engaging resources for teaching, continuous learning, and professional development.
